text: Is there a quickstart on how to convert a tensorflow/python notebook to Flux? (I know almost nothing of Flux.)

elements.text: Is there a quickstart on how to convert a tensorflow/python notebook to Flux? (I know almost nothing of Flux.)

text: The notebooks I have in mind are in MIT 6.S191.

elements.text: The notebooks I have in mind are in MIT 6.S191.

text: I don’t think there is such a guide. Probably your best bet is to ping here as issues come up that the docs don’t answer.

elements.text: I don’t think there is such a guide. Probably your best bet is to ping here as issues come up that the docs don’t answer.

text: There aren’t major differences at the highest API level between Flux and PyTorch (just names and arguments). The concepts should line up quite well.

elements.text: There aren’t major differences at the highest API level between Flux and PyTorch (just names and arguments). The concepts should line up quite well.

text: If you do end up converting those notebooks to Flux, I would host it on Github. It would be a nice contribution to the ecosystem.

elements.text: If you do end up converting those notebooks to Flux, I would host it on Github. It would be a nice contribution to the ecosystem.

text: We’ll see. I’ve learned Tensorflow earlier, but I haven’t use PyTorch.

elements.text: We’ll see. I’ve learned Tensorflow earlier, but I haven’t use PyTorch.

text: Differences between Tensorflow and PyTorch are easy to find in google.

elements.text: Differences between Tensorflow and PyTorch are easy to find in google.

attachments.title: PyTorch vs TensorFlow for Your Python Deep Learning Project – Real Python
attachments.text: PyTorch vs Tensorflow: Which one should you use? Learn about these two popular deep learning libraries and how to choose the best one for your project.
attachments.fallback: PyTorch vs TensorFlow for Your Python Deep Learning Project – Real Python

text: It might be easiest to convert Tensorflow first to PyTorch and then Flux. Well, maybe not easiest in the grand scheme of things, but there’s more hope in finding good articles on that. (Quick googling produced only hits in how to convert pre-trained models from Tensorflow to PyTorch.)

elements.text: It might be easiest to convert Tensorflow first to PyTorch and then Flux. Well, maybe not easiest in the grand scheme of things, but there’s more hope in finding good articles on that. (Quick googling produced only hits in how to convert pre-trained models from Tensorflow to PyTorch.)
